name: Warehouse Location â€“ CR3
content: Warehouses may optionally operate in an expanded mode. In expanded mode, a warehouse can serve more stores but requires paying an additional upgrade fee. The decision of whether to operate a warehouse normally or in expanded mode is part of the optimization. All other servicing rules apply as before.
value_info:
`fixed_cost`: Integer fixed cost for opening a warehouse.
`capacities`: List of normal capacities per warehouse.
`capacity_expanded`: List of expanded capacities per warehouse (must exceed capacities).
`upgrade_cost`: Additional cost for enabling expanded mode on each warehouse.
`supply_cost`: A 2D matrix where supply_cost[i][j] is the cost of assigning store i to warehouse j.

var1.descr: `w`: A list of length n_stores, where w[i] is the index of the warehouse assigned to store i.

var2.descr: `o`: A list of binary values of length n_warehouses, where o[j] = 1 if warehouse j is open.

var3.descr: `upgrade`: A list of binary values of length n_warehouses, where upgrade[j] = 1 if warehouse j uses the expanded capacity.

var4.descr: `total_cost`: The total objective value after considering supply costs, fixed warehouse opening costs, and expansion costs.
